attributes.action: Make Multiple Chemical Sensitivity a recognised syndrome in the NHS, NICE & WHO.
attributes.background: The debilitating illness, MCS, needs to become a recognised syndrome/disease, whereby patients can get the appropriate care and medical assistance that they so desperately need, so that no more lives are lost as a result of it. Specialised doctors and odorless hospital quarters need to be available.

rejection.details:
This is a clinical matter for the NHS and the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE), not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to fund research into Multiple Chemical Sensitivity if that is something you'd like to happen.
